author: philip
msg: Fix a use-commit-times bug reported by Norbert Unterberg <nepo@gmx.net>,
the text-timestamp in the entries file didn't match the working file.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(install_file): Issue commands to set the text-timestamp in the entries
file after, rather than before, changing the working copy timestamp.
Also, stop changing the working file's timestamp when the file is
locally modified.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/stat_tests.py
(get_last_changed_date): New helper function.
(timestamp_behaviour): Verify the use-commit-times affects text-timestamp.

author: cmpilato
msg: Drop r12738 from candidacy; use r12904 instead.

author: cmpilato
msg: A piece of issue #2199.  Check paths entering Subversion via
mod_dav_svn custom REPORT requests for canonicalization, erroring if
they don't pass muster.  (This was attempted once in r12738, reverted
in r12903.  This time I'm shrinking the scope to just mod_dav_svn.)
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/dav_svn.h
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/util.c
(dav_svn__test_canonical): New.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/file_revs.c (dav_svn__file_revs_report)
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/update.c (dav_svn__update_report)
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/log.c (dav_svn__log_report)
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/version.c (dav_svn__get_locations_report)
Check all paths delivered in the REPORT request body for
canonicalization.  Also, use dav_error_new_tag() instead of
dev_new_error() wherever possible so users can actually see these
error returns.

author: cmpilato
msg: Revert r12738.  I'm going to re-do that change, but *only* tweak
mod_dav_svn, not expose a new public (and not-even-half-implemented)
svn_path_is_canonical().
[Note from the future: this is done now, see r12904.]

author: sunny256
msg: A couple of typo fixes in the svnbook.
* doc/book/book/ch04.xml
(svn-ch-4-sect-3.2.3): Two typo fixes.
